Package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.cielab

Class GradientTools

java.lang.Object
com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.cielab.GradientTools
public class GradientTools extends Object
Static methods for handling gradients of smoothly-changing colors, typically inside of FloatArrays. The intent is for the FloatArray to be used as a sequence of packed float CIELAB colors. You can create a new FloatArray gradient with makeGradient(float, float, int, Interpolation), but any FloatArray will work (although it only makes sense if it contains packed float colors or is empty). Once you have a FloatArray, you can pass it to appendGradient(FloatArray, float, float, int, Interpolation) to make a gradient between two colors, or appendGradientChain(FloatArray, int, Interpolation, float...) to make a gradient between more than two colors. You can also customize each section between colors with appendPartialGradient(FloatArray, float, float, int, Interpolation), which is just like appendGradient() but doesn't add the end color (since it is the start color of the next partial gradient, until you finally end by appending just the end). Using appendPartialGradient(), you can have each transition use a different number of steps.
This class does some special handling for CIELAB colors.

  • Method Details

    • makeGradient

      public static com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray makeGradient(float start, float end, int steps)
      Creates a FloatArray gradient from the packed float CIELAB color start to the packed float CIELAB color end, taking the specified number of steps and using linear interpolation. This limits individual steps of color to the correct CIELAB gamut, so even interpolations between colors at extreme points in the color space will stay in-gamut.
      Parameters:
      start - the packed float CIELAB color to start with
      end - the packed float CIELAB color to end on
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2, and must be non-negative
      Returns:
      a new FloatArray that contains the requested gradient

    • makeGradient

      public static com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray makeGradient(float start, float end, int steps, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Interpolation interpolation)
      Creates a FloatArray gradient from the packed float CIELAB color start to the packed float CIELAB color end, taking the specified number of steps and using the specified Interpolation for how it transitions. This limits individual steps of color to the correct CIELAB gamut, so even interpolations between colors at extreme points in the color space will stay in-gamut.
      Parameters:
      start - the packed float CIELAB color to start with
      end - the packed float CIELAB color to end on
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2, and must be non-negative
      interpolation - a libGDX Interpolation that can be used to customize how start transitions to end
      Returns:
      a new FloatArray that contains the requested gradient

    • appendGradient

      public static com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray appendGradient(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray appending, float start, float end, int steps)
      Appends a gradient from the packed float CIELAB color start to the packed float CIELAB color end, taking the specified number of steps and using linear Interpolation for how it transitions. This limits individual steps of color to the correct CIELAB gamut, so even interpolations between colors at extreme points in the color space will stay in-gamut.
      Parameters:
      appending - a FloatArray that will be appended to
      start - the packed float CIELAB color to start with
      end - the packed float CIELAB color to end on
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2
      Returns:
      appending, after adding the gradient to the end

    • appendGradient

      public static com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray appendGradient(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray appending, float start, float end, int steps, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Interpolation interpolation)
      Appends a gradient from the packed float CIELAB color start to the packed float CIELAB color end, taking the specified number of steps and using the specified Interpolation for how it transitions. This limits individual steps of color to the correct CIELAB gamut, so even interpolations between colors at extreme points in the color space will stay in-gamut.
      Parameters:
      appending - a FloatArray that will be appended to
      start - the packed float CIELAB color to start with
      end - the packed float CIELAB color to end on
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2
      interpolation - a libGDX Interpolation that can be used to customize how start transitions to end
      Returns:
      appending, after adding the gradient to the end

    • appendGradientChain

      public static com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray appendGradientChain(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray appending, int steps, float... chain)
      Appends a gradient between several packed float CIELAB colors provided in chain. This uses linear Interpolation for the whole gradient. Appends to the end of appending and produces a total of steps colors.
      Parameters:
      appending - a FloatArray that will be appended to
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2
      chain - an array or varargs of packed float CIELAB colors that this will interpolate through in order
      Returns:
      appending, after adding the gradient to the end

    • appendGradientChain

      public static com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray appendGradientChain(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray appending, int steps, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray chain)
      Appends a gradient between several packed float CIELAB colors provided in chain. This uses linear Interpolation for the whole gradient. Appends to the end of appending and produces a total of steps colors.
      Parameters:
      appending - a FloatArray that will be appended to
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2
      chain - a FloatArray of packed float CIELAB colors that this will interpolate through in order
      Returns:
      appending, after adding the gradient to the end

    • appendGradientChain

      public static com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray appendGradientChain(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray appending, int steps, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Interpolation interpolation, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray chain)
      Appends a gradient between several packed float CIELAB colors provided in chain. This uses the specified Interpolation for the whole gradient, which can make some colors use smaller sections than others. Appends to the end of appending and produces a total of steps colors.
      Parameters:
      appending - a FloatArray that will be appended to
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2
      interpolation - a libGDX Interpolation that can be used to customize how start transitions to end
      chain - a FloatArray of packed float CIELAB colors that this will interpolate through in order
      Returns:
      appending, after adding the gradient to the end

    • appendGradientChain

      public static com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray appendGradientChain(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray appending, int steps, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Interpolation interpolation, float... chain)
      Appends a gradient between several packed float CIELAB colors provided in chain. This uses the specified Interpolation for the whole gradient, which can make some colors use smaller sections than others. Appends to the end of appending and produces a total of steps colors.
      Parameters:
      appending - a FloatArray that will be appended to
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2
      interpolation - a libGDX Interpolation that can be used to customize how start transitions to end
      chain - an array or varargs of packed float CIELAB colors that this will interpolate through in order
      Returns:
      appending, after adding the gradient to the end

    • appendPartialGradient

      public static com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray appendPartialGradient(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray appending, float start, float end, int steps)
      Exactly like appendGradient(FloatArray, float, float, int), but does not include end in what it appends to appending. This is intended for the implementation of chained gradients, where the end of a previous gradient becomes the start of the next one. This still uses the specified number of steps, it just doesn't append end in the last step.
      Parameters:
      appending - a FloatArray that will be appended to
      start - the packed float CIELAB color to start with
      end - the packed float CIELAB color to end just before
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2
      Returns:
      appending, after adding the gradient to its end

    • appendPartialGradient

      public static com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray appendPartialGradient(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.FloatArray appending, float start, float end, int steps, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Interpolation interpolation)
      Exactly like appendGradient(FloatArray, float, float, int, Interpolation), but does not include end in what it appends to appending. This is intended for the implementation of chained gradients, where the end of a previous gradient becomes the start of the next one. This still uses the specified number of steps, it just doesn't append end in the last step.
      Parameters:
      appending - a FloatArray that will be appended to
      start - the packed float CIELAB color to start with
      end - the packed float CIELAB color to end just before
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2
      interpolation - a libGDX Interpolation that can be used to customize how start transitions toward end
      Returns:
      appending, after adding the gradient to its end
